top_rare_diseases.description: A genetic disorder affecting the type IV collagen in kidneys, ears, and eyes.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Alport Syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by kidney inflammation (nephritis), leading to chronic kidney disease. It often affects hearing and vision.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Progressive kidney disease leading to end-stage renal failure.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Mutations in COL4A3, COL4A4, or COL4A5 genes.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests, blood tests, kidney biopsy, genetic testing.
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, immunosuppressants; dialysis or kidney transplant in advanced cases.
clinical_trials: Evaluation of ACE Inhibitor Therapy Efficacy

top_rare_diseases.description: An autoimmune kidney disease causing inflammation.
top_rare_diseases.overview: IgA Nephropathy is an autoimmune disease where IgA antibodies lodge in kidneys, causing inflammation and damage.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Can lead to chronic kidney disease and failure if untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Abnormal IgA antibodies depositing in kidneys.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests, blood tests, kidney biopsy.
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, corticosteroids, fish oil; immunosuppressants in severe cases; dialysis or transplant.

top_rare_diseases.description: Characterized by excessive protein loss through urine.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Nephrotic Syndrome is a kidney disorder marked by heavy proteinuria, leading to hypoalbuminemia and edema.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Increased risk of infections and thrombosis.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Glomerular damage due to various diseases.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests, blood tests, kidney biopsy.
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants; diuretics for edema.
